sec.p:
We calculated the radiative forcing due to atmospheric perturbations in CH 4 and CO 2 concentration for CLM and AThaw permafrost-soil-carbon flux trajectories following Frolking & Roulet
87 (Supplementary Methods). Methodology underlying our remote-sensing based quantification of abrupt thaw in Alaska and field-based estimates of carbon emissions from abruptly-formed thermokarst areas of lakes in Alaska and Siberia are also provided inÂ Supplementary Methods. Field and lab measurements include bubble-trap observations of ebullition fluxes, aerial and ground-based ebullition seep-mapping, and quantification of CH 4 and CO 2 concentrations and radiocarbon dating.
